Home Motherhood Happy Living Pic&Flix Science&Innovation Tech&Gadgets Gamer's Guide Religion Odds&Ends Have you seen this? Video of the Day About this ad Italian Pic Nic Pants' come with built in table By Stephanie Grimes April 2nd, 2012 @ 1:31pm 25 Comments Post or read comments Related Links
Page Two: Odds&Ends
Photo Gallery» SALT LAKE CITY—The latest in functional fashion comes in the form of pants you can eat off of. In an apparent desire to provide a must-have function, Italian design company Acquacalda has created a pair of pants that doubles as a table—perfect for those times you find yourself wishing you could eat off your lap without committing to grease stains on your favorite pair of pants. The denim harem capris have a gray flap attached to the front that reportedly stretches out to become a portable table when one sits cross- legged. "Fashion imposes forms to whom finding a function seems a must," the site reads, lending itself to the notion that food-ready pants are more of a "need" than a "want." Would you wear them? 1. Give me Pic Nic Pants or give me death. 2. I wouldn't be caught dead wearing these. Would you wear them? 1. Give me Pic Nic Pants or give me death. 2. I wouldn't be caught dead wearing these. "Pic nic pants take advantage of the usual cross-legged position to become a comfortable surface useful for consumption of a meal outdoors," it continues. The pants include an "orientable pocket" for drinks, as well. The pants are real—no April Fools' Day joke, here—but there's no word on how much a pair costs. And as of now, the idea doesn't seem to be catching on in the U.S.: according to an MSNBC poll, only 6 percent of respondents would wear the pants.
